definition: li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
a monument/an upright stone tablet/stele/CL:塊|块[kuai4],面[mian4]

sentences.english: Each new version of Windows is a visible and significant milestone for the company.
sentences.chinese: 視窗的每一個新版本都是一個有目共睹的重要里程碑。

sentences.english: Music snobbery is a cornerstone of indie music.
sentences.chinese: 音樂勢利是獨立音樂的里程碑。

sentences.english: The launch marks a milestone for the country's space program.
sentences.chinese: 這次發射標誌著印度航空計劃的一個新的里程碑。

sentences.english: It's been a milestone year for Jay Chou.
sentences.chinese: 對周杰倫來說，今年是里程碑式的一年。

sentences.english: After all, the landmark Indo-US nuclear deal is immensely advantageous for India.
sentences.chinese: 畢竟，里程碑式的印美核協議對印度非常有利。

sentences.english: Yita Circuits was a milestone in the development of Xinjiang Province system.
sentences.chinese: 伊塔道的設置是新疆行省制度發展的一個里程碑。

sentences.english: The former as a target of mountainside depressions, now has established a milepost.
sentences.chinese: 那昔日當作目標的山腰窪地，而今已樹立起里程碑。

sentences.english: The Killers of Three Kingdoms represents a milestone in the market.
sentences.chinese: 在棋類遊戲市場，三國殺是一個里程碑。

sentences.english: The stealth fighter is a milestone in the world history of military aviation.
sentences.chinese: 隱形戰機是世界軍事航空史上的一個里程碑。

sentences.english: Even in the sweltering heat, the milestones keep coming.
sentences.chinese: 儘管悶熱難當，我們已經跑過了一連串的里程碑。

sentences.english: For me, the biggest milestone is that we have reached August.
sentences.chinese: 對我來說，最大的里程碑就是進入了八月。

sentences.english: Another type of review is the phase and milestone review.
sentences.chinese: 另一類型的評審是階段和里程碑評審。

sentences.english: "Aarhus Convention" is the milestone of environmental information disclosure system.
sentences.chinese: 《奧胡斯公約》是環境信息公開制度發展的里程碑。

sentences.english: Distributed component technology is a landmark of distributed computing technology.
sentences.chinese: 分佈構件技術是分佈計算技術的又一個里程碑。

sentences.english: Military Science of Sun Bin marks a milestone in Chinese military history.
sentences.chinese: 《孫臏兵法》在中國軍事發展史上具有里程碑的意義。

sentences.english: The invention of printing was a mile-stone in people progress.
sentences.chinese: 印刷術的發明是人類進步的一個里程碑。

definition: strategic pass/barrier or mark (i.e. a level considered impressive, usually a round figure such as 10,000)/instrument of torture used to break limbs
variant of 記錄|记录[ji4 lu4] (but in Taiwan, not for the verb sense "to record")
accomplishment/success/achievement/CL:個|个[ge4]/to achieve (a result)/to create/to bring about
career/life (way in which sb lives)/period of one's life
to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
